revised_title: Postural and Non-Postural Activities of the Mid-Brain: A Study on Decerebrate Monkeys
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on decerebrate monkeys to study the postural and non-postural activities of the mid-brain. They discovered that certain lower centres in the brain control postural activities of the limbs, and that stimulation of the mid-brain can evoke specific postures in the animals. The study provides insights into the functioning of the motor cortex and neural pathways.
